Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, possibly a column-krater; interior glazed; exterior: part of incised upright lotus flower and bud with added red on one petal, on outside leaves and on collar. Seemingly cut as a roundel. Remains of one large red inclusion in the clay.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.571.a, 1888,0601.571.b, 1888,0601.572 and 1965,0930.803.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0132) (Phase 1)
